result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian J Mendoza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:07 am cases called. Defendant Adrian J Mendoza in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader requesting adjournment for 950 complaince. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi regarding bond. 10:10 pm court recesses for parties to discuss matter. 10:13 am case recalled. Same appearances. Statement by DA Blader.-Will amend Count 1 of 15CM90 to Disorderly Conduct.  Statement by Attorney Szilagyi. Offer stated on record. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts motion of State to amend Count 1 of 15CM90. Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 15CM79. No Contest to Count 1 of 15CM90. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 15CM79, Count 2 of 15CM90, & 15CM123. Statement by victim. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: Court deferrs sentencing on 15CM79 for a period of 6 months. 15CM90-Impose and stay 20 days jail. If revoked with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 3 days served.  STAYED and places on probation for 1 year. CONDITIONS:  Psychological exam to be completed and follow through with any treatment or prescriptions recommended. Continue working with DHS and Heather Copp. No Contact with A.C. Any contact with victim to prompt Probation Review Hearing within 5 days. Court orders a probation review hearing at the same time as Deferred sentencing hearing on 15CM79. Court requires review of 15CV24 as well. If defendant complies court will allow petition for expunction.  Court authorizes the defendant to participate in graduation ceremony at Wautoma High School with rehersal on Friday May 22, 2015 and ceremoney on Saturday May, 23, 2015. Defendant is allowed to attend the letter ceremony on June 8, 2015.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.

The defendant is prohibited from being on the premises of Wautoma Area High School whatsoever with the sole exception that the defendant may be dropped off and picked up for all scheduled baseball related activities at the high school. He is not permitted to use the locker room facilities at the school.  The defendant is permitted to participate on the baseball team .  The defendant is prohibited from being in possession of or using a cell phone. Defendant is prohibited of being in possession of any dangerous weapons. Defendant is prohibited from using a computer without supervision by Pastor Timmerman and/or his tutor and is prohibited from contacting anyone via social media.

1:03 pm case called. Defendant Adrian J Mendoza in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Adrian J Mendoza in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond recommendations by counsel. Court questions Attorney Szilagyi regarding representation of contact.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
